# String.LocalizationValue.Placeholder

**Enumeration**

An enumeration of types that can appear as a placeholder in a string interpolation.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Placeholder
```

## Overview

Foundation uses this type when you create a string with the `\(placeholder: type)` syntax and supply an array of replacement values in a `String.LocalizationOptions`. Placeholders work with [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/String] initializers that take an `options:` parameter:

- [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/String/init(localized:options:table:bundle:locale:comment:)]
- [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/String/init(localized:options:)]
- [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/String/init(localized:defaultValue:options:table:bundle:locale:comment:)]

You only use this type directly when specifying one of its enumeration cases in the placeholder syntax, like `\(placeholder: .int)`.

## Placeholder types

- **String.LocalizationValue.Placeholder.int**: The signed integer type, as used for replacement values with the localized string placeholder syntax.
- **String.LocalizationValue.Placeholder.uint**: The unsigned integer type, as used for replacement values with the localized string placeholder syntax.
- **String.LocalizationValue.Placeholder.float**: The single-precision floating-point type, as used for replacement values with the localized string placeholder syntax.
- **String.LocalizationValue.Placeholder.double**: The double-precision floating-point type, as used for replacement values with the localized string placeholder syntax.
- **String.LocalizationValue.Placeholder.object**: The object type, as used for replacement values with the localized string placeholder syntax.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
